overview:
Design as a bridge

Architecture speaks of space, form, place, and function while integrated Architectural Graphic Design communicates a building’s function, purpose, message, and narrative. Effective and appropriate Architectural Graphic Design supports the statement made by a building and strengthens its presence. The architectural graphics layered into the conversation derive from the built context, spatial context, cultural context, and historical context. They are not independent nor superficial. The Architectural Graphic Design layer has meaning, form, function, and purpose… similar to the architecture.

The inclusion of the Architectural Graphics creates a strong sense of place, fulfills human needs, helps users find their way, and communicates a building’s narrative, fostering a strong conversation between the person and place.    

For more check out the related articles below.

name: Experiential Graphic Design

overview:
Engaging the physical space

As experiential graphic designers, architects, and storytellers, RSM Design has made the core focus of our work to create graphic designs for the built environment, or Experiential Graphic Design. RSM Design works to skillfully communicate the authenticity and uniqueness of the brand into an experiential graphics and signage system that identifies a project’s character and reinforces its personality through the signage, wayfinding, and specialty graphics. The creative work of the studio is the transformative process of turning brick, glass, steel, and concrete into a place with soul and style. Experiential design transforms an environment by creating places for people to linger, guides them to new destinations, and facilitates shared experiences. With the expertise of successful branding and graphic design, we forge a subconscious connection by building immersive experiences that resonate and connect people to the places they are visiting.
